SEARCH
Package com.evry.FinLimit.services

Class TransactionService

java.lang.Object
com.evry.FinLimit.services.TransactionService
@Service public class TransactionService extends Object
Service class that handles business logic for working with transactions. It includes operations for adding transactions to the database, adding a default limit to the client if it does not exist yet getting a list of transactions that have exceeded the limit

  • Constructor Details

    • TransactionService

      public TransactionService()

  • Method Details

    • save

      public void save(TransactionDTO transactionDTO)
      Saves a transaction to the database. Converts the provided TransactionDTO to an entity and persists it using the repository.

      Note: The account limit check is performed separately to avoid blocking transactions.

      Parameters:
      transactionDTO - the transaction data transfer object to be saved

    • getTransactionsExceedingLimits

      public List<TransactionWithLimitDTO> getTransactionsExceedingLimits(Long accountId)
      Retrieves transactions that exceed the account's limits.

      This method fetches all transactions and limits associated with the given account, then groups transactions by the most relevant limit. Transactions that exceed their corresponding limits are identified and returned.

      Parameters:
      accountId - the ID of the account for which transactions should be checked
      Returns:
      a list of transactions that exceed the account's limits

    • processTransactionsByLimit

      public void processTransactionsByLimit(Map<Limit,List<TransactionWithLimitDTO>> transactionsByLimit, List<Long> result, List<BigDecimal> debts)
      Processes transactions based on their associated limits.

      Iterates over the grouped transactions and their corresponding limits. If there are existing debts, the available limit is first adjusted by repaying the debt. Then, it calculates the remaining limits for each transaction and updates the result list accordingly.

      Parameters:
      transactionsByLimit - a map containing limits as keys and their associated transactions as values
      result - a list to store transaction IDs that exceed their respective limits
      debts - a list of outstanding debts to be considered when processing limits

    • debtRepayment

      public BigDecimal debtRepayment(BigDecimal limitSum, List<BigDecimal> debts)
      Reduces the available limit by repaying outstanding debts.

      Iterates through the list of debts, subtracting each one from the available limit. If the limit becomes negative, the remaining debt is stored back in the list, and the negative limit is returned. If all debts are repaid within the available limit, the remaining balance is returned.

      Parameters:
      limitSum - the available limit before debt repayment
      debts - a list of outstanding debts to be repaid
      Returns:
      the remaining limit after debt repayment (may be negative if the limit was exceeded)

    • calculateRemainingLimits

      public void calculateRemainingLimits(List<TransactionWithLimitDTO> transactionsLim, BigDecimal limit, List<Long> result, List<BigDecimal> debts)
      Calculates the remaining limits after processing transactions.

      Iterates through the list of transactions, converting their amounts to a common currency and subtracting them from the available limit. If the limit becomes negative, the transaction ID is added to the result list. Any remaining negative balance (uncovered amount) is stored as debt.

      Parameters:
      transactionsLim - a list of transactions associated with the limit
      limit - the available limit before processing transactions
      result - a list to store transaction IDs that exceed the limit
      debts - a list to store any remaining negative balances as debts

    • findRelevantLimit

      public Limit findRelevantLimit(TransactionWithLimitDTO transaction, List<Limit> limits)
      Finds the most relevant limit for a given transaction.

      Filters the list of limits to include only those with a date that is not after the transaction date. Then, selects the most recent limit (the one with the latest date). If no matching limit is found, returns null.

      Parameters:
      transaction - the transaction for which a relevant limit is being searched
      limits - a list of limits associated with the account
      Returns:
      the most recent applicable limit for the transaction, or null if none is found

    • convertCurrency

      public BigDecimal convertCurrency(BigDecimal amount, CurrencyShortname currency, LocalDateTime dateTransactional)
      Converts a given amount from one currency to USD using the exchange rate at a specific transaction date.

      Constructs the currency exchange rate pair using the provided currency and USD. Retrieves the exchange rate for the given date and multiplies the amount by this rate to perform the conversion.

      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to be converted
      currency - the original currency of the amount
      dateTransactional - the date of the transaction for which the exchange rate is needed
      Returns:
      the converted amount in USD
